xwikidoc.title: Getting Started with ROS in MATLAB/SIMULINK

= **Introduction** =
----
With all the available tools and possibilities which come with ROS. MATLAB/SIMULINK gives us an additional range of solutions for testing and implementing new ROS nodes in our ROS environment. Also the handling of ROS Nodes with MATLAB/SIMULINK is a little less abstract.
What we will do in this Tutorial to get a good idea of how ROS Works with Matlab and Simulink. And how to let your ROS-nodes communicate with each other when they are located on different platforms. (We use MATLAB but start our ROS-core and other nodes in a Virtual machine.)
To perform this Tutorial the official "Robotics System Toolbox" from MATLAB/SIMULINK needs to be installed. It's recommended to work through [[ROSGettingStarted>>http://wiki.lit.fh-dortmund.de/bin/view/Projects/MoRoP/ROS%20GettingStarted/]] previous to this Tutorial. Additional you can work through the tutorials provided in the MathWorks documentation: [[MathWorks - Get started with ROS>>https://de.mathworks.com/help/robotics/examples/get-started-with-ros.html]] and the subsequent tutorials. Those tutorials focus on the solely Work with MATLAB/SIMULINK without the use of other platforms.
In the beginning we will start a simple ROS network with our roscore on a virtual Linux-machine and a global MATLAB-node on our Host-System and will create a simple Publisher and Subscriber who will perform cross-platform communication.
